com.xtructure.xneat.evolution.impl
Class AbstractNEATReproductionStrategy<D>

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractEvolutionObject
      com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>
          com.xtructure.xneat.evolution.impl.AbstractNEATReproductionStrategy<D>
All Implemented Interfaces:
EvolutionObject, ReproductionStrategy<D>, NEATReproductionStrategy<D>
Direct Known Subclasses:
NEATReproductionStrategyImpl
public abstract class AbstractNEATReproductionStrategy<D>
extends AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>
implements NEATReproductionStrategy<D>

AbstractNEATReproductionStrategy implements the NEATReproductionStrategy interface. It orchestrates the creation of child genomes, selecting which genomes will reproduce and via which of MutateOperator or CrossoverOperator.

Calls to generateChildren(Population) ignore the given count, instead producing from each species a number of children determined by that species number of elites and it's target size. Also, when using a CrossoverOperator, with a certain probability (specified by NEATEvolutionFieldMap.interspeciesCrossoverProbability()) a genome may reproduce with another in a different species.

The NEATReproductionStrategy with attempt to create children until the requested count has been reached; if no operator with succeed with any genome, the method will loop. It's recommended to use at least one Operator that will always succeed, e.g., CopyMutateOperator or CopyCrossoverOperator.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

generateChildren

public java.util.Set<Genome<D>> generateChildren(Population<D> population)
Description copied from interface: ReproductionStrategy
Creates a set of Genome children based on the given Population. Genomes are selected for reproduction via roulette selection, weighted by fitness.

If when attempting to produce a child no Operator succeeds, then a different reproduction attempt is made; all of the returned children are products of an Operator.

The number of children produced is enough to bring the population size to that specified by the the EvolutionFieldMap, after dead genomes have been removed.

Specified by:
generateChildren in interface ReproductionStrategy<D>
Overrides:
generateChildren in class AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>
Parameters:
population - the pool of potential parent genomes
Returns:
the set of Genome children.
